channel.title: Programs in Memory :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: YouTube Video Info The above video and below textbook content cover the same ideas (but are not identical). Feel free to pick one or the other. Before we move on to our next concept, it is helpful to explore how programs use memory. Remember that modern computers are stored program computers, which means the program as well as the data are stored in the computerâ€™s memory. A Universal Turing Machine, the standard example of a stored program computer, reads the program from the same paper tape that it reads its inputs to and writes its output to.
